channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023120401
item.description:
Report X-2023120401

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA with a wet upper corner. 1 bottle inside showed signs of leaking,. Due to way package was wet inside and out, it had to have been loaded on the trailer either upside down or on it's side in defiance of orientation arrows. DescribePack: 1 bottle from the corner that was wet had slightly less volume than the other 3 bottles. Possible loose cap and improper loading in trailer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote until it could be processed.

DescribePack: at least 2 of 4 plastic bottles of liquid leaked approximately 0.6 gallons through closures that leak despite seeming tight, soaking box and all contents DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: placed in plastic tote under vent hood

item.title: Report E-2023120073
item.description:
Report E-2023120073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: GERMANTOWN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading at the facility where a drum dolly was being used the handler attempted to grab the drum and tip it back when the foot of the dolly slipped out from the bottom and the drum rolled over striking the foot of the dolly on the side causing a puncture in the side of the drum. Approximately 3-5 cups was released onto the floor of the truck. The handler immediately grabbed absorbent material to contain the spill. The in house response team then dawned the proper PPE and began to clean up the material and overpack the damaged drum and dispose of the absorbent material in the appropriate manor. The event only lasted 15-30 minutes start to finish.
